column1: Campos Gerais National Park (Portuguese: Parque Nacional dos Campos Gerais) is a national park in the state of Paraná
The Campos Gerais National Park has an area of 21

column2: and is administered by the Chico Mendes Institute for Biodiversity Conservation.

column1: The park lies in the Paraná municipalities of Ponta Grossa
Vegetation includes mixed forest and areas grassland.
Ball cactus and Sinningia leucotricha are endemic.
The park holds the main sources of the Tibagi River and the Ribeira de Iguape River.
As a National Park the basic objective is the preservation of natural ecosystems of great ecological relevance and scenic beauty
column2: enabling the conduct of scientific research and educational activities
column3: and supporting outdoor recreation ecological tourism.
